reviewText: The Spy Kids series are no work and good to just sit down with on a rainy Sunday and watch with the little ones.The three pack we received had some type of issue and simply would not play in the main CD player, but loaded up very well on the CD player in the bedroom. The CD player was checked with other CD's and worked fine. Definately the CD's, and all three had the same problem.That said the movies make no pretence, they are family fun and aimed at the pre-teen age group.With that in mind none can be said to be low budget, the acting is good even from the children, the sets are reasonable quality and the storylines very acceptable for that demographic.They even work as quiet escapism for adults who haven't really quite grown up yet.Overall 4 stars, but keeping in mind the target audience, the lack of gore and nastieness, the absence of swearing and abuse that make it all just good clean fun I'd have given 5 stars if they'd played in both machines.An inexpensive purchase that is certainly not regretted.
Title: The Spy Kids Trilogy

reviewText: I purchased this because my son loved the Spy Kids 3. He had never seen the 1st or 2nd, I thought these would be good to watch together. reviewText: My 8 year old son has started watching the Spy Kids series recently, and the movies are aimed at kids aged 7-10.  The protagonists are pre-teens who get to use cool gadgets, go on unrealistic "missions," and deal with not-too-scary (almost silly) villains.  Overall, these are non-violent, fast-paced movies, and considering all three movies, my husband and I didn't find anything overtly obnoxious about the characters or story lines.  The brother and sister spy team get along (mostly), and their parents (also spies) are involved and caring.  The latter two movies even involve the grandparents, who turn out to be much cooler than the kids' expected.The current Amazon price is just under $11, so that's definitely worth it for all three movies.
Title: The Spy Kids Trilogy

reviewText: I love these Spy Kids. By having all three movies in one folder, I can really see how these two young actors grow through the making of the moves. Also, it's fun watching Antonio Banderas in a different venue from what he usually does. He is a very good comedic actor. But, the way Rodriguez puts together these movies is simply works of art.

reviewText: I am OLD.  I mean REALLY OLD--but still a couple years younger than Mr. Trejo. (Oops sorry, I didn't meant to insult Mr. Trejo as he continues to look way younger than he is.) He looks good in long or short hair! He obviously loves working with kids. But I still really enjoyed them.  I believe they were made in 2001, 2002 and 2003.  I had never seen them before.  The animation was good, the characters were funny, and the story lines were very funny and entertaining.  In each of them just as I was getting really involved in the story a well known star that I've seen recently in a dramatic role would pop up and surprise me with their comedic talent. I loved all of the gadgets.  I loved seeing Ricardo Montalbon picking on Mr. Banderas.  The brother-sister relationship was believable with the back and forth tormenting. (Reminded me of the good old days with my brother.)  I especially loved Mr. Stallone and his other "personalities". That was really funny.I was impressed with literally every aspect of these movies--and Mr. Rodriguez has made many more since then.  I think I will have to start searching for dvd's by who made them besides who is in them.  Keep up the good work, Mr. Rodriguez.
summary: What a fun set of movies for old and young!
Title: The Spy Kids Trilogy

reviewText: My boys enjoyed watching these movies when they were little so I bought them on DVD to have for my grandchildren.
Title: The Spy Kids Trilogy
